documents.title: Program | Nordic Fintech Week
documents.meta_description: Nordic Values, Global Impact Building Trustworthy Fintech for a Sustainable Future. More details to follow — stay tuned! Leading with purpose: Advancing a f ...
documents.content: [META] Nordic Values, Global Impact Building Trustworthy Fintech for a Sustainable Future. More details to follow — stay tuned! Leading with purpose: Advancing a f ... Nordic Values, Global Impact Building Trustworthy Fintech for a Sustainable Future. More details to follow — stay tuned! Leading with purpose: Advancing a financial ecosystem that champions the planet and people Meet our 2025 Track Sponsors Payments Reimagined: Seamless, Secure, and Smart Wealth Management and Capital Markets: Democratization and Personalization Fintech’s Role in Sustainability and Climate Leadership Insurance Innovation: Towards Proactive Protection Talent 2035: Developing Skills for the Fintech Future Digital Identities: Balancing Innovation, Privacy, and Security Digital Assets, Crypto, and the Rise of Decentralized Finance AI and the Evolution of Human-Centric Financial Services Financial Crime, Fraud Prevention, and Cybersecurity Resilience Composable Banking and Banking-as-a-Service: Modular and Adaptable Finance Embedded Finance and SME Empowerment Navigating Geopolitics: Implications for Nordic Fintech and beyond The main theme for Nordic Fintech Week 2025 centers on the intersection of Nordic values and global impact, exploring how we can build a more inclusive, sustainable, and human-centered financial ecosystem. Fintech is rapidly evolving, transforming financial services and redefining access, efficiency, and inclusion across society. This transformation is not only about emerging technologies—it’s about ensuring innovation remains human-centered, ethically aligned, and focused on long-term impact. From human-AI collaboration and decentralized finance to sustainability, modular systems, and regulatory complexity, this year’s conversations will explore how the Nordic region can lead in building transparent, resilient, and people-first financial systems. Explore how cutting-edge payment technologies and innovations are reshaping customerexperiences and business interactions. From instant settlements and frictionless checkoutsto AI-driven financial assistants, discover how next-generation payments are deliveringefficiency, security, and personalized experiences. Delve into scenarios where traditionalfinancial institutions leverage AI and open finance frameworks to regain trust and redefinetheir relationships with customers towards 2035. Dive into the transformative impact of fintech on wealth management and capital markets,focusing on how technology creates more accessible, transparent, and personalizedinvestment experiences. Understand how AI-driven platforms could reshape advisoryservices, empowering investors with real-time insights and sophisticated portfoliomanagement previously reserved for the few. Examine how fintech solutions are pivotal in addressing sustainability goals, enablinginvestments in green technologies, promoting responsible consumption, and trackingenvironmental impact. Discover how Nordic fintech can facilitate scenario-basedcollaboration between traditional institutions, startups, and regulators, accelerating thetransition towards sustainable and environmentally responsible financial practices. Discover how digitalization and AI-driven analytics are transforming insurance into proactive,personalized protection. From predictive risk assessments and automated claims processingto embedded insurance products, explore how these technologies will reshape consumerexpectations and industry standards, creating a more intuitive, efficient, and securecustomer experience across financial ecosystems. Investigate the future of talent development, workplace transformation, and skill-building asfintech reshapes employment landscapes. Explore what skills will be required in an AI-enhanced, digitally interconnected Nordic fintech industry, and how institutions can attract,nurture, and retain talent prepared for scenarios involving high degrees of technologicaladoption and complexity by 2035. Explore the critical intersection of digital identity, data privacy, and cybersecurity. Nordicfintech thrives on trust, transparency, and responsible data usage; this session tackles howinstitutions can securely and ethically manage digital identities, safeguard personal data, andenhance trust in digital ecosystems amid increasingly sophisticated cyber threats. Navigate the rapidly evolving landscape of digital assets, cryptocurrency, CBDCs, anddecentralized finance (DeFi). This session examines how these innovations will reshapefinancial institutions’ roles, consumer autonomy, and market dynamics, envisioning ascenario in which DeFi significantly disrupts legacy financial structures and pushestraditional banks towards infrastructure and regulatory oversight roles by 2035. Discuss how AI and automation technologies are reshaping the very nature of financialservices, focusing on scenarios where institutions successfully integrate AI-driven services toenhance customer relationships and operational efficiency. Consider how proactive,personalized financial guidance and human-AI collaboration redefine banking by 2035. Uncover the evolving landscape of financial crime and fraud prevention in an eraincreasingly defined by digital interactions. Discuss how Nordic fintech companies leverageadvanced analytics, AI, and cybersecurity strategies to proactively detect and mitigatethreats, safeguarding trust, financial stability, and digital resilience as the geopoliticalenvironment introduces new complexities and cyber vulnerabilities. Analyze how modular, flexible financial systems enable rapid adaptation to shifting marketneeds and regulatory demands. Explore the scenario of increased geopolitical fragmentation, driving financial institutions toward composable banking solutions thateffectively navigate regulatory divergence and local market requirements while maintainingseamless user experiences. Examine how embedded finance is empowering SMEs by integrating tailored financialservices seamlessly into their everyday business processes. Explore the Nordic scenariowhere banks become orchestrators of digital ecosystems, allowing SMEs easier access tofinancing, analytics-driven decision-making tools, and streamlined operations—enablingrapid growth and more resilient business communities. Reflect on how geopolitical dynamics influence fintech development, regulation, and marketintegration. Explore potential scenarios where geopolitical tensions could drive regionalspecialization or fragmentation, compelling Nordic fintech firms to develop adaptive,compliant strategies capable of thriving under uncertainty. Consider how geopoliticalawareness is vital for fintech firms aiming to sustain innovation, cooperation, and competitiveadvantage.

documents.title: About Us | Nordic Fintech Week
documents.meta_description: About us Get an overview of who we are. Who is behind Nordic Fintech Week? It’s 2016, and the newly formed Copenhagen Fintech team foresees the need for the ...
documents.content: [META] About us Get an overview of who we are. Who is behind Nordic Fintech Week? It’s 2016, and the newly formed Copenhagen Fintech team foresees the need for the ... About us Get an overview of who we are. Who is behind Nordic Fintech Week? Point Zero Forum X Nordic Fintech Week Contact us.We'll be happy to hear from you Wassa CamaraProject Manager wac@nfweek.com David GrundyChief Operations Officer dag@copenhagenfintech.dk Thomas KroghCEO tkj@copenhagenfintech.dk Thomas Hahn-Petersen,Head of Marketing & Communications thp@copenhagenfintech.dk Andrei Anghel,Head of Programs aan@copenhagenfintech.dk Nicolette Tham,Head of Community and Events nth@copenhagenfintech.dk It’s 2016, and the newly formed Copenhagen Fintech team foresees the need for the Nordic financial sector to come together, connect, and exchange knowledge to strengthen the ecosystem and put Nordic fintech on the global radar. The first conference went live in 2017 as “Copenhagen Fintech Week,” a small gathering in Copenhagen harbor, a time in which the fintech sector was still unaware of any hype and jargon. Growing year by year, “Copenhagen Fintech Week” changed its name in 2022 to “Nordic Fintech Week”, to better reflect its role as leading community-driven fintech conference in Northern, that enables growth for the Nordic fintech ecosystem through facilitating global network, partnerships, and knowledge – what we call “Nordic Innovation, Global Scale”. A history of pioneering digital adoption with a strong emphasis on design and user friendliness, an open-minded and e-ready population, a high-trust society with commitment to equality and democracy, close collaborations between public authorities and local startups – all of this has made it possible for the Nordics to be a prime spot for Fintech development. In the true Nordic knowledge-sharing ethos, Nordic Fintech Week is the hotpot to get local and global perspective, the place to create connections and partnerships that will lead the way to the financial industry of tomorrow. Lets build the future of fintech, together at Nordic Fintech Week 2025. Connecting the Nordics to Global Fintech Challenges At Nordic Fintech Week, we believe that understanding global challenges is essential for Nordic fintech companies to thrive on the world stage. That’s why we’ve partnered with the Global Finance and Technology Network (GFTN) to bridge our vibrant innovation ecosystem with global thought leadership. While we champion startups and collaboration here in the nordic countries, GFTN’s Point Zero Forum in Zurich tackles the policies and frameworks shaping the future of global finance. Together, we’re equipping Nordic companies to scale, compete, and lead worldwide. Use code NFW30 for 30% off tickets to the Point Zero Forum and join us in shaping the global fintech landscape.

documents.title: FAQs | Nordic Fintech Week
documents.meta_description: 2026 FAQs and Venue Information You have questions, we have answers At The Venue Event Is the event content in English?Yes, the event will be hosted in Engl ...
documents.content: [META] 2026 FAQs and Venue Information You have questions, we have answers At The Venue Event Is the event content in English?Yes, the event will be hosted in Engl ... 2026 FAQs and Venue Information You have questions, we have answers At The Venue Event Tickets Brella Networking App Get in Touch Getting There By Bus By Metro By Bike By Car Yes, the event will be hosted in English. The full program is available on ourprogrampage and it will also be made available on our event platform two weeks before the event. The program is subject to change, make sure to double check it before the event. You can find the venue map at the bottom of this page Copenhagen Airport is conveniently situated in Kastrup, just 6km away from the venue and 8km away from the city centre. Getting to the venue from the airport is a breeze! Just hop on theM2 line of the Metrovia Vanløse or catch a cab for a quick ride. If you’d like to take ataxi, you can reach the city centre in around 20-30 minutes. Prices typically range from 250-350 DKK, depending on the traffic. Copenhagen is also easily reachableby ferryfrom other Nordic countries, including Norway and Sweden. Our team at Nordic Fintech Week wants you to have the best possible experience which is why we have prepared our venue to host all the comforts a modern and leading event can offer.Here you will find refreshments and food as well as lounging areas and wifi connection. Being said that, you’ll definitely want to pack anything you deem necessary to make the best out of the conference like your Also, don’t forget to bring any medication or any other necessary items that you would bring with you if you expected to be away from home for a long period of time. Nordic Fintech Week will be on September 24-25 at TAP1 — a premier event venue located in beautiful Copenhagen. Raffinaderivej 10, 2300 Copenhagen, Denmark. For specific instructions on how to get there navigate to the “Getting There” section at the bottom of this page. The Nordic Fintech Research Symposium will be held on 23 September at The Old Celebratory Hall at University of Copenhagen,4 Frue Plads 1168 København. Metro:M2(towards Copenhagen Airport). Get off at Lergravsparken St. or Øresund St. – 20 min walk from TAP1.Find information about the public transportation atrejseplanen.dk. The area offers 300 parking spaces paid by the hour through the app, EasyPark. Nordic Fintech Week is accessible for people with restricted mobility as the main entrance of the venue is connected to a ramp. Furthermore, the venue offers accessible toilets. Explore our recommended hotels and enjoy exclusive deals for the duration of the event: Hotel Guldsmedens– 10% discount with codeCPHFINTECH10Scandic Hotels– 14% discount with codeD000055808through thislinkGo Hotels –15% discount with codeFintech2026 When you arrive at the venue, you’ll spot the Check-In area in zone 1. That’s where you can grab your name badge and a wristband, which you must keep on you at all times to gain entry to Nordic Fintech Week 2025. Check out the venue map at the bottom of this page to learn where zone 1 is located. We have an info desk located at the same location as our reception and check-in desks. There will be a full staff on site both days during opening hours. Yes, we do have a free-of-charge cloakroom available at the check-in desk Food and non-alcoholic beverages are complimentary and available in our lounge and bar area located in Zone 2. Our food buffet will serve a light breakfast, refreshments, and lunch on both days of the event at no extra charge. There will also be a BBQ hosted by Mastercard. We will also host an afterparty on the second day that you won’t want to miss. This closing event will be your last chance to network. That’s why we’ve made public WiFi available to all our guests. The password will be displayed on your name badge . We also have a WiFi network available for exhibitors only. Password: You can find the PW in the exhibitor manual or request it at the info desk. Log-in details can be found on your name badgeas well as inbanners near the info-desk Our entire venue is considered a networking area where you can meet and mingle with the Nordics most influential Fintech leaders. We’ve also designated a private one-on-one area where you can have dedicated meetings. These meetings can be booked in advance using the Brella app. In-app bookings will become available as we get closer to the event. Look out for our newsletter announcement. Don’t wait too long once the announcement is made, places fill fast! Not sure how to use the Brella app? Check out our Brella FAQs section below. At Nordic Fintech Week 2025, your safety and security are our top priorities. We’re all in this together, so if you notice anything out of the ordinary, don’t hesitate to speak up. In the unlikely event of any security concerns, please reach out to our friendly staff at the Info Desk or the nearest security personnel. You’ll easily spot them at the event entrance and throughout the venue. Rest assured, our dedicated security team is not only well-trained in basic first aid but also equipped to swiftly coordinate with first responders for any more serious situations. Remember, 112 is the emergency services number in Denmark. Don’t hesitate to ring that number if you find yourself in an emergency situation. Let’s make Nordic Fintech Week 2023 a safe and enjoyable experience for everyone! If you happen to lose or find something during the event, kindly make your way to the Info Desk, and our friendly team will be glad to assist you and log the details. You can purchase tickets directly on our website by navigating to our tickets pagehere Sure! The instructions on how to change the ticket allocation are included in your ticket. Yes, just to clarify, each ticket is valid for one person only. However, you can transfer the ticket to someone else if needed. Brella is a complete event platform built for networking, bringing you a powerful and relevant networking experience ✨ At Nordic Fintech Week, we leverage this powerful app to: 1️⃣ Help our attendees book one-on-one meetings 3️⃣ Prepare for an incredible experience at Nordic Fintech Week Two weeks before the event all ticket holders will be invited to join the Brella app where you’ll get to manage your event experience and book one-on-one networking meetings with other attendees. The invite is personal and unique so please check the details on your ticket(s) to make sure that we have the correct info and ensure that you maximize your NFW2023 experience. When you get the invitation to join Brella, you simply need to sign up for the platform and create your profile. In the app, we offer a detailed and thorough list of interests relevant to you and the industry at large. Choose topics that accurately reflect your interests, and decide on the goals you’ll like to achieve during the event. Your choices will feed the app’s AI-powered algorithm with information that will help personalize your experience. Once you complete your profile, you’ll immediately see your recommended matches. Make sure you book a meeting with your first match. To book a meeting simply select a profile, choose an available time, and send a meeting request to start the discussion. When booking 1:1 meetings through Brella you will automatically be awarded a meeting spot in our 1:1 meeting zone. Show up on event day to enjoy the most amazing content and attend 1:1 meetings! Fill your schedule with meetings and maximize your time at Nordic Fintech Week The app is available in both the Apple Store and Google Play Store While you can enjoy our event without using the Brella app, we absolutely recommend using it. With its AI-based matchmaking tool and complete overview of the Nordic Fintech Week program, it’s your ticket to enjoying the best possible experience and making the most out of the event. Fun fact: 90% of meetings are booked via the Brella app even before Nordic Fintech Week kicks off. Therefore, it’s important to get on the app if you want to take advantage of one-on-one meetings and networking. In-app bookings will become available as we get closer to the event, typically two-weeks before the start date. Look out for our newsletter announcement. Don’t wait too long once the announcement is made, places fill fast! For contact information, please visit ourabout uspage, where you can find information corresponding to each of our departments. Bus 37“Raffinaderivej” – 5 min walk from the venue Bus 31“Holmbladsgade” – 10 min walk from the venue To find more information about public transport by bus navigate towww.rejseplanen.dk M2 line(towards Copenhagen Airport). Get off at Lergravsparken St. or Øresund St. – 10 min walk from the venue To find more information about public transportation by metro navigate towww.rejseplanen.dk The venue is easy to reach by bike with plenty of parking available. The venue is located in Raffinaderivej 10 where over 300 parking spaces are available for conference guests, bypaying for the parking spaces via the Easy Park app. • Bus:Bus 37“Raffinaderivej” – 5 min walk from TAP1Bus 31“Holmbladsgade” – 10 min walk from TAP1Metro:M2(towards Copenhagen Airport). Get off at Lergravsparken St. or Øresund St. – 20 min walk from TAP1.Find information about the public transportation atrejseplanen.dk. • Taxi:Nordic Fintech Week has partnered with Viggo, a fully electric taxi company operating exclusively with zero-emission cars. Viggo will offer a 10% discount to all Nordic Fintech Week attendees, with the code sent directly to all ticket holders.Download the Viggo app.

documents.content: [META] Nordic Values, Global Impact Building Trustworthy Fintech for a Sustainable Future. Leading with purpose: Advancing a financial ecosystem that champions the ... Nordic Values, Global Impact Building Trustworthy Fintech for a Sustainable Future. Leading with purpose: Advancing a financial ecosystem that champions the planet and people Please view the full program and activities happening at NFW25 on the Brella app. Contact comms@nfweek.com if you have a NFW25 ticket and trouble accessing the app. Based on the main theme, we’ve crafted 12 core tracks for Nordic Fintech Week 2025. Each track reflects a balance between innovation, human-centric transformation, and sustainability: Payments Reimagined: Seamless, Secure, and Smart Wealth Management and Capital Markets: Democratization and Personalization Fintech’s Role in Sustainability and Climate Leadership Digital Assets, Crypto, and the Rise of Decentralized Finance AI and the Evolution of Human-Centric Financial Services Financial Crime, Fraud Prevention, and Cybersecurity Resilience Insurance Innovation: Towards Proactive Protection Composable Banking and Banking-as-a-Service: Modular and Adaptable Finance Talent 2035: Developing Skills for the Fintech Future Embedded Finance and SME Empowerment Digital Identities: Balancing Innovation, Privacy, and Security Navigating Geopolitics: Implications for Nordic Fintech and beyond Meet our 2025 Track Sponsors Payments Reimagined: Seamless, Secure, and Smart Wealth Management and Capital Markets: Democratization and Personalization Fintech’s Role in Sustainability and Climate Leadership Insurance Innovation: Towards Proactive Protection Talent 2035: Developing Skills for the Fintech Future Digital Identities: Balancing Innovation, Privacy, and Security Digital Assets, Crypto, and the Rise of Decentralized Finance AI and the Evolution of Human-Centric Financial Services Financial Crime, Fraud Prevention, and Cybersecurity Resilience Composable Banking and Banking-as-a-Service: Modular and Adaptable Finance Embedded Finance and SME Empowerment Navigating Geopolitics: Implications for Nordic Fintech and beyond The main theme for Nordic Fintech Week 2025 centers on the intersection of Nordic values and global impact, exploring how we can build a more inclusive, sustainable, and human-centered financial ecosystem. Fintech is rapidly evolving, transforming financial services and redefining access, efficiency, and inclusion across society. This transformation is not only about emerging technologies—it’s about ensuring innovation remains human-centered, ethically aligned, and focused on long-term impact. From human-AI collaboration and decentralized finance to sustainability, modular systems, and regulatory complexity, this year’s conversations will explore how the Nordic region can lead in building transparent, resilient, and people-first financial systems. Explore how cutting-edge payment technologies and innovations are reshaping customerexperiences and business interactions. From instant settlements and frictionless checkoutsto AI-driven financial assistants, discover how next-generation payments are deliveringefficiency, security, and personalized experiences. Delve into scenarios where traditionalfinancial institutions leverage AI and open finance frameworks to regain trust and redefinetheir relationships with customers towards 2035. Dive into the transformative impact of fintech on wealth management and capital markets,focusing on how technology creates more accessible, transparent, and personalizedinvestment experiences. Understand how AI-driven platforms could reshape advisoryservices, empowering investors with real-time insights and sophisticated portfoliomanagement previously reserved for the few. Examine how fintech solutions are pivotal in addressing sustainability goals, enablinginvestments in green technologies, promoting responsible consumption, and trackingenvironmental impact. Discover how Nordic fintech can facilitate scenario-basedcollaboration between traditional institutions, startups, and regulators, accelerating thetransition towards sustainable and environmentally responsible financial practices. Navigate the rapidly evolving landscape of digital assets, cryptocurrency, CBDCs, anddecentralized finance (DeFi). This session examines how these innovations will reshapefinancial institutions’ roles, consumer autonomy, and market dynamics, envisioning ascenario in which DeFi significantly disrupts legacy financial structures and pushestraditional banks towards infrastructure and regulatory oversight roles by 2035. Discuss how AI and automation technologies are reshaping the very nature of financialservices, focusing on scenarios where institutions successfully integrate AI-driven services toenhance customer relationships and operational efficiency. Consider how proactive,personalized financial guidance and human-AI collaboration redefine banking by 2035. Uncover the evolving landscape of financial crime and fraud prevention in an eraincreasingly defined by digital interactions. Discuss how Nordic fintech companies leverageadvanced analytics, AI, and cybersecurity strategies to proactively detect and mitigatethreats, safeguarding trust, financial stability, and digital resilience as the geopoliticalenvironment introduces new complexities and cyber vulnerabilities. Discover how digitalization and AI-driven analytics are transforming insurance into proactive,personalized protection. From predictive risk assessments and automated claims processingto embedded insurance products, explore how these technologies will reshape consumerexpectations and industry standards, creating a more intuitive, efficient, and securecustomer experience across financial ecosystems. Analyze how modular, flexible financial systems enable rapid adaptation to shifting marketneeds and regulatory demands. Explore the scenario of increased geopolitical fragmentation, driving financial institutions toward composable banking solutions thateffectively navigate regulatory divergence and local market requirements while maintainingseamless user experiences. Investigate the future of talent development, workplace transformation, and skill-building asfintech reshapes employment landscapes. Explore what skills will be required in an AI-enhanced, digitally interconnected Nordic fintech industry, and how institutions can attract,nurture, and retain talent prepared for scenarios involving high degrees of technologicaladoption and complexity by 2035. Examine how embedded finance is empowering SMEs by integrating tailored financialservices seamlessly into their everyday business processes. Explore the Nordic scenariowhere banks become orchestrators of digital ecosystems, allowing SMEs easier access tofinancing, analytics-driven decision-making tools, and streamlined operations—enablingrapid growth and more resilient business communities. Explore the critical intersection of digital identity, data privacy, and cybersecurity. Nordicfintech thrives on trust, transparency, and responsible data usage; this session tackles howinstitutions can securely and ethically manage digital identities, safeguard personal data, andenhance trust in digital ecosystems amid increasingly sophisticated cyber threats. Reflect on how geopolitical dynamics influence fintech development, regulation, and marketintegration. Explore potential scenarios where geopolitical tensions could drive regionalspecialization or fragmentation, compelling Nordic fintech firms to develop adaptive,compliant strategies capable of thriving under uncertainty. Consider how geopoliticalawareness is vital for fintech firms aiming to sustain innovation, cooperation, and competitiveadvantage. documents.title: Tickets | Nordic Fintech Week
documents.meta_description: At Nordic Fintech Week 2025 you’ll have the opportunity to meet and network with the most influential founders and visionary companies in the industry.
documents.content: [META] At Nordic Fintech Week 2025 you’ll have the opportunity to meet and network with the most influential founders and visionary companies in the industry. Get your ticket Let's build the future of finance, together. Nordic Fintech Week 2025: Innovation. Collaboration. Impact. Get your Ticket General Investor Scaleup Startup Can't find the right ticket type? Talents, Academia & Government and Media you find your ticketshere For further details on tickets and other inquiries, please contact us. Thomas Hahn-Petersen Head of Marketing & Communications +45 60776006 thp@copenhagenfintech.dk Nordic Fintech Week aims to impact the global fintech landscape by fostering a community culture of collaboration, innovation, and growth. ​The event provides a unique platform for startups, established financial institutions, investors, and regulators to have meaningful conversations that redefine the future of finance. ​In 2025, the conference will engage over 2,500 participants from more than 50 countries all continents. Buy now for access to limited capacity side events! • Unlimited 2 day access • Meet Exhibitors & Startups • Content Across 3 Stages • Access to Side Events • Access to Networking App • Unlimited 2 day access • Access to Investor Activities • Meet Exhibitors & Startups • Access to Stages & Side Events • Access to Networking App • Unlimited 2 day access • Meet Exhibitors & Startups • Content Across 3 Stages • Access to Side Events • Access to Networking App • Unlimited 2 day access • Meet Exhibitors & Startups • Content Across 3 Stages • Access to Side Events • Access to Networking App

documents.title: Home | Nordic Fintech Week
documents.meta_description: The one and only. The greatest fintech conference in the nordics. We can't wait to see you there in September!
documents.content: [META] The one and only. The greatest fintech conference in the nordics. We can't wait to see you there in September! The biggest finance and fintechconference in the Nordics. 2026 September 21-25 Copenhagen The Nordic Fintech Week 2025 Aftermovie Meet our 2025 Partners Some of our 2025 Speakers Christie Kristensen Chris Colbert Henrik Stiesdal Johanna Vigdis Gudmundsdottir Peter Hubli Dorrit Kromann Ulrik Nødgaard Chris Skinner Some of our 2024 Speakers Alessandro Vilardi Bjørn Sibbern​ Einar Eidsson​ Esben Seyffart Sorensen​ Franziska Steiner​ Gareth Genner Jesper Bjerre​ Jesper Schleimann Johanna Norberg​ John Lundsgaard​ Kasper Tjørntved Davidsen​ Kim Wikan Barth​ Leda Glyptis Lise Pretorius Louise Mogensen Maria Hjorth​ Mathias Wikström​ Michael McKay​ Natalia Shchelovanova Ornit Shinar Peter Smith Sophie Winwood​ Srishti Jain Andreasen​ Stine Kalmer Jørgensen​ Susan M. Barton​ Meet our 2025 Community Partners Meet our 2025 Media Partners Meet visionaries, explore trends, and shape the future - together at the leading fintech event in the Nordics. The Nordic Fintech Week is designed for you to connect to some of the most influential founders, thinkers, and visionaries of the Nordic fintech ecosystem and learn about the latest industry trends. Our mission is to put on stage the Nordic Innovation that is turning our remarkable region into a Fintech powerhouse. Join us for a one-of-a-kind fintech experience and be part of the future of fintech. In our 2025 edition, we brought together the entire Nordic Fintech Ecosystem at the number one go-to event in the region and forge connections to global fintech innovators. Thank you for an incredible Nordic Fintech Week 2025, we can’t wait to welcome you back in 2026! Integrations Partnership Manager ∙ Danske Bank VP Sales, Marketing & Business Development ∙ Keystrike Inc. Head of Digital Assets Solutions ∙ Zuercher Kantonalbank EMEA & Asia Digital Solution Director – CRIF VNTR, Innovation and Venturing – PostFinance​ Head of Business Customers & Country Manager Sweden – Danske Bank​ Director, Growth and New Services – Gjensidige​ Client-first exec | NED | Advisor | Author | Speaker​ Chief Sustainability Analysis Officer – Matter​ Vice President Digital Products – Novo Nordisk Global Innovation and Ecosystem, InnovEcos Lead – CRIF Executive Head of Global Business Development – RS Software​

documents.title: Startups | Nordic Fintech Week
documents.meta_description: Made in the Nordics. Built for Fintech Founders. See you at the Global Fintech Arena, where grit meets opportunity Explore the startup program The truth The ...
documents.content: [META] Made in the Nordics. Built for Fintech Founders. See you at the Global Fintech Arena, where grit meets opportunity Explore the startup program The truth The ... Made in the Nordics.Built for Fintech Founders. See you at the Global Fintech Arena, where grit meets opportunity The truth The founders (you) Global Fintech Arena For illustration purposes. All upgrade booths and spots in the arena includes seating. Pricing Limited spots left! Global Fintech Arena -Upgrade Join us at the arena Global Fintech Arena We are looking for Fintechs that are Hop on a call with us Curious about the Arena and how your Fintech might fit in? Let’s chat. We’ll keep it short, sweet, and straight out of the Nordics. They’re right. The work, the waiting, the uncertainty, it’s a mental avalanche. Sometimes it’s pushing through the grind with little to show for it. Sometimes it’s stalling a team dinner because you’re waiting on a maybe. And staying the course when walking away would be easier? That’s the hardest part. We won’t pretend otherwise, and we know you don’t either. At Nordic Fintech Week, we have built a space for the real ones: the hoodie wearing, pitch perfectionists, late night worrying kind of founders and teams. Whether you are chasing your next investor or your newest breakthrough in AI, the Global Fintech Arena is where you’ll move, laugh, think and collide with the kind of serendipity that turns into partnerships, sales calls, and investor coffees. So, bring your laptop, your people, and your A-game. That’s why we have curated a handful of straight-talking, actually useful masterclasses for Fintechs showcasing in the arena. Learn how to own the room with Steve Morris on storytelling, get inside an investor’s head with Mike Sigal, finally understand term sheets (without the legal headache), and walk away with sharper sales tactics from Jamie Reynolds. We are opening the doors this year to The Vertical Rooms. A series of thematic demo sessions focused on the biggest opportunity areas in Fintech. Think ESG & Climate, AI, and Insurance & Pension and more. Fintechs selected for each theme will get to showcase what they’re building to an audience of potential partners, investors, and decision-makers looking for real solutions. And for those ready to pitch, we’re also running a dedicated Investor and Partnership Track, connecting selected fintechs with our investor network and Copenhagen Fintech partners. Now in its 6th edition, the Nordic Fintech Awards celebrate the startups and scaleups redefining finance across the region and spotlighting bold ideas and the people behind them. Finalists are evaluated by a jury of industry leaders, including experts from Citi, Visa, EY, UNDP, Microsoft, and Chainalysis. Recognition here isn’t just a badge, it’s a signal to investors, partners, and the ecosystem that you’re building something that matters. This is where visibility turns into momentum. The best part of Nordic Fintech Week isn’t just the stage, it is who you meet off it. In the Global Fintech Arena, you’re not just getting a booth. You are stepping into a space full of founders deep in the build phase, figuring out sales, chasing funding, and pivoting hard. Just like you are. We have carved out time for real connection: BBQs, padel, coffee chats, and the kind of serendipity that doesn’t happen over LinkedIn. The Launchpad Library is for early-stage fintechs, and those mid-pivot, who want to share what they’re building in a more personal, interactive way. We’re also opening it up in the 2nd edition for book launches. Speakers and ecosystem friends will get space to bring their ideas to life and give their work the airtime it deserves at Nordic Fintech Week. Sometimes the biggest win is just having your own space to show up. At the arena, every Fintech gets a physical spot, because we know being visible matters at a conference. You can join a shared setup with other Fintechs in your vertical (we’ll keep it simple, branded, and easy), or go for a standalone upgrade booth if you want something that’s fully yours (1x2m² and a bit more presence). 3 full access tickets1x2m2 booth* with a custom backdropBranding in the conference app (Brella)Announcement on LinkedInSocial media assets to help you promote your presence – Masterclasses– The Vertical Rooms (Demo Days)– Investor & Partner Showcases– Launchpad Library *GFA standard package includes generic branding setup by Nordic Fintech Week. The furnishing and branding of the GFA upgrade package needs to be booked through CPH Lounge (added expense of approx. 530 EUR excl. VAT). 2 full access ticketsSpot in the GFA * with your logoBranding in the conference app (Brella)Announcement on LinkedInSocial media assets to help you promote your presence – Masterclasses– The Vertical Rooms (Demo Days)– Investor & Partner Showcases– Launchpad Library *GFA standard package includes generic branding setup by Nordic Fintech Week. Around 1–2 years old or more, and officially registered (e.g. with a CVR in Denmark) With some product–market fit and a live product or demo you can showcase at the Arena Able to attend in person with at least one team member (ideally two) across both days, so you can really make the most of the event Ready to use the Brella (networking app) platform to follow the program, set up meetings, and plug into the full Nordic Fintech Week experience • Around 1–2 years old or more, and officially registered (e.g. with a CVR in Denmark) • With some product–market fit and a live product or demo you can showcase at the Arena • Able to attend in person with at least one team member (ideally two) across both days, so you can really make the most of the event • Ready to use the Brella (networking app) platform to follow the program, set up meetings, and plug into the full Nordic Fintech Week experience

documents.title: Awards | Nordic Fintech Week
documents.meta_description: Nordic Fintech Awards Proudly presented by A chance to celebrate and recognise the best Fintechs in the Nordics. In its 6th edition, the Nordic Fintech Awar ...
documents.content: [META] Nordic Fintech Awards Proudly presented by A chance to celebrate and recognise the best Fintechs in the Nordics. In its 6th edition, the Nordic Fintech Awar ... Nordic Fintech Awards Proudly presented by A chance to celebrate and recognise the best Fintechs in the Nordics. Meet the Nordic Fintech Awards 2025 Winners Award Categories New Entry New Entry Growth Growth Impact Impact Growth New Entry Impact Process Nordea Presented the Nordic Fintech Awards 2025 Questions? Please reach out to Mehnaaz Maleta, Project Lead at Copenhagen Fintech: Mehnaaz Maleta Project Lead mma@copenhagenfintech.dk In its 6th edition, the Nordic Fintech Awards have once again celebrated the startups and scaleups redefining finance across the region, spotlighting bold ideas and the people behind them. The finalists were evaluated by a jury of industry leaders, including experts from Citi, Visa, EY, UNDP, Microsoft, and Chainalysis. Recognition here isn’t just a badge, it’s a signal to investors, partners, and the ecosystem that you’re building something that matters. This is where visibility turns into momentum. For Nordic Fintech companies driving the transformation of financial ecosystems with AI solutions that are clearly embedded in their core products. For Nordic Fintech companies on a strong growth trajectory over the past five years, marked by expansion in customer base, investment rounds, team size, international presence, and operational scale. For early-stage Nordic Fintech companies founded in 2023 or later, offering a market-ready solution and showing promising traction through customer adoption, funding milestones, or team growth. For Nordic Fintech companies developing solutions that promote inclusivity, sustainability, and human-centered impact, supporting stronger communities and a healthier planet. Nominationsare sourcedfrom Nordic Fintech hubs and the broader community. Copenhagen Fintechcurates the shortlistbased on the submitted nominations. An expert juryevaluates the shortlisted companiesand selects two finalists per category.
